Reviews.Title: Great Little BLUE Tablet (See Updates Below)
Reviews.Author: Noname

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2HHOF1FIY82NPcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2HHOF1FIY82NPcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:46 MinsEach time I get a new generic Android tablet, I like it better than the last. The Simbans Tablet PC is a pleasure to use. I am a casual user. I don't do gaming. I like to surf and do email and read ebooks. The Simbans is perfect for me.SCREENI would like to take a minute to go over something that is almost never mentioned in reviews. Oleophobic screens are so ubiquitous, we think every screen is like that. Let me tell you, I've used other generic Android tablets. Inexpensive tablets don't always have the oleophobic screen. What's that mean? Touch your iPhone or Kindle and you will feel a slick sensation. Rub that screen on your shirt and the fingerprints come off. Cheap tablets that don't have that type of screen will grab fingerprints like you wouldn't ever believe possible, and they don't come off so easily.The Simbans screen is oleophobic. Now that I know it's possible to get an oleophobic screens on an inexpensive tablet, I'm not going to accept anything less.WIRELESSThe Simbans Tablet PC supports Wi-Fi but not Bluetooth. The Wi-Fi connection is quick and very good. I don't have any issues with it. I have it set to be on during sleep so that when I wake it up, I have instant internet access.BATTERY LIFEBattery life is good. It doesn't last more than a day (waking hours) through moderate usage, but it's long enough that I don't feel like I'm constantly recharging.WEB BROWSINGI find web browsing to be a pleasant experience. I use the pre-installed Chrome browser almost exclusively, not the native browser. It's simply smoother.Video reviews on Amazon don't stream (the native browser is slow and stutters, and Chrome can't stream them at all), but video reviews don't stream on the Fire or iPhone, either. YouTube videos play without problems.CAMERAThere are front and rear cameras on this tablet. The rear camera has higher quality images and videos than the front-facing camera. In fact, the front camera seems to point at an angle to my right, so that I have to angle the tablet to get my face centered on screen.I do like the rear camera a lot. As someone who doesn't Skype or take selfies, it's the one I'd use most. The Simbans rear camera is the best of all my generic Android tablets.BOOTING UPI normally have the tablet on sleep mode. Occasionally, I'll power it off. Turning it on, it sometimes hangs on the splash screen. I solve that by doing a soft reset (holding the power button down until the screen turns off). This isn't a problem waking up from sleep mode.PROS:+ Wi-Fi capable+ HDMI port+ Micro SD card support+ Front and rear cameras+ Oleophobic screenCONS:- No Bluetooth- Front camera at an angle, isn't as good quality as rear camera- Boot up sometimes hangs on splash screenOVERALL IMPRESSIONThis is a very good introductory tablet, or for the casual user or children. Heavy users may want something more, but I wouldn't hesitate to pick this up to read a book or check my email or surf the web. It's a great little tablet.This product was provided for review by Simbans Electronics.__________________UPDATE 3/1/14: You may see two video reviews for this product from me on one listing. Pay attention to the color. One is for the blue tablet, the other for the pink tablet. These product listings were merged by Amazon, but they are very different tablets. It's not just the color and the physical placement of the ports and camera. You will also see a difference in sound, video and photo capabilities.__________________UPDATE 3/3/14: I do not know what is going on with the listings. At first, the colors were separate. I wrote reviews for the pink and blue tablets. The two tablets are different tablets. They have different port and camera placements and the quality of sound and cameras are different. The listings for the blue and pink were merged so that all colors were on one page. Now, they are separated and my blue tablet review is stuck on the pink tablet page.Please, folks, this is a review for the BLUE tablet. It was originally posted on the BLUE tablet page. Now, it's stuck on the pink tablet page, but even as I edit this review, I am editing on the BLUE tablet page. I don't know how to get it on the proper page. Maybe Amazon will move it back again.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Prince Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son's birthday and he just loves it. The shipment was quick. It has a very good Battery life too.I loaded it with lots of games until the storage was full, so slipped in a SD card to increase the storage to 32GB, now there is more than enough space.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet in its Class
Reviews.Author: J Hunter
Reviews.Content: I think this is probably the best tablet after the ipad and other top branded and expensive tablets for the price.I bought it for my son for his 2nd birthday and he loves it.This is the perfect gift if you want something less than $100 tablet. if you can afford an iPad then don't buy this one - I didn't want  my son to ruin my tablet, and was looking for a more affordable alternative and this is exactly what the doctor ordered.Pros:1. Inexpensive2. Excellent speed for internet browsing and games3. Wifi is good and works around the house4. Can hold a good number of apps and music before you have to put in SD card to expand the storage5. Perfect for a giftCons -1. no complaints so far. I was not even expecting what I already received for less than $70.

Reviews.Title: it has a mind on its own
Reviews.Author: JSM
Reviews.Content: this tablet is the worst out of all the devices i have ever lay my hands on. it arrived a day late thats one thing. it came in a decent way no scratches and it seem like everything is intact. then after charging it for the whole day i checked and its only 69% and i saw that the power plug has the wrong amperage, then i began using it.. right away as soon the screen starting to go crazy and all the key were pressing themselves.. i tried to deal with it until i was typing and keep in mind i havent save anything yet then boom the home button was pressed and then shuts off... there goes my freakin presentation. all in all this tablet that i got really is the suckiest of all the suckiest out there... so becareful of what you get when buying this tablet... btw it wont update worth of **** and there is no way of contacting them cause there is no no. and the website dont exsist online... dont buy this

Reviews.Title: Simbans 7" Dual Core Tablet w/ Dual Camera
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: I have received the tablet which I ordered but I have not been satisfied at all with my purchase. The tablet runs very slowly and it is constantly freezing up. The battery does not hold a charge so I am constantly having to recharge the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Good for Price but finicky
Reviews.Author: Jessica B. Hart
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these for my kids and they like that it holds the battery charge pretty well and that it can be charged with a USB and even my phone charger rather than the wimpy little plug that comes with the unit and tends to break easily. I will say that it freezes up and sometimes there are issues with the screen not responding so if you are looking for a quality tablet, this may not be it. However, I think this is good for kids because it does what it needs to for the gaming and is fairly sturdy.

ProductInfo.Features:
Fastest Quad Core processor. Better Looks and Build
At a fraction of the cost of an ipad or other tablets, it gives best value for money.
Browse internet via WiFi without paying any 3G charges
A large number of FREE games can be downloaded from Google Play
Enjoy movies on YouTube and it also supports streaming via NetFlix
ProductInfo.Name: Simbans (TM) S81W 8 Inch Quad Core Tablet PC - IPS Screen, 1 GB RAM, 8GB, Android 4.1, 1.2Ghtz , WiFi, Camera, G Sensor - WHITE
